title: Ashley's Chicken Katsu with Tonkatsu Sauce Recipe
description: Panko (Japanese bread crumbs) crusted fried chicken breasts with a sweet Tonkatsu dipping sauce. Serve with your choice of steamed white rice, shredded cabbage, or even mashed potatoes.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Japanese Ashley's Chicken Katsu with Tonkatsu Sauce 4.3 (123) 96 Reviews 24 Photos A recipe for delicious Japanese fried chicken and an accompanying Tonkatsu sauce. Serve with your choice of shredded cabbage, rice, or even mashed potatoes. Submitted by BASKETBALLGIRL Updated on November 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 24 24 24 24 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 2 Yield: 2 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings Sauce ½ cup Worcestershire sauce ¼ cup ketchup 2 tablespoons soy sauce pepper to taste Chicken 2 cups vegetable oil, for deep-fat frying ½ cup all-purpose flour ½ cup panko bread crumbs salt and pepper to taste 1 egg, beaten 2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded to 1/4 inch thickness 1 green onion, thinly sliced Directions For the sauce, stir together the Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, and soy sauce, and a pinch of pepper to taste. Set aside. Heat oil in deep-fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place flour and panko bread crumbs onto separate plates and season with salt and pepper. Place the beaten egg in a medium bowl. Dip flattened chicken pieces first into flour, then egg, and lastly bread crumbs. Fry breaded chicken breasts in preheated oil until golden brown and no longer pink in center, about 8 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to absorb excess oil. Slice chicken into thin strips and top with a drizzle of sauce and a sprinkling of sliced green onions. Serve remaining sauce on the side for dipping. I Made It Print 143 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 718 Calories 37g Fat 73g Carbs 30g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 718 % Daily Value * Total Fat 37g 47% Saturated Fat 7g 34% Cholesterol 137mg 46% Sodium 2290mg 100% Total Carbohydrate 73g 27% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Total Sugars 15g Protein 30g 60% Vitamin C 15mg 17% Calcium 127mg 10% Iron 7mg 39% Potassium 947mg 20% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Ashley's Chicken Katsu with Tonkatsu Sauce 01 of 24 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 24 Photo by  BriefBowl8129 05/20/2023 I have been using this recipe as a base since I first had it ( as take out’ ) party dish @ my brothers house in Honolulu. 1985I use Panko.. but substitute corn starch for the flour step..use a good organic egg from my six laying Rhode Island Hens .. ( yup, I’m bragging about my girls.. best eggs ever lolthis original recipe is is my guideline and I have shared it with hundreds of people ..making it tonight.. will share a pic later.. thank you 03 of 24 Photo by  Sarah Garcia 10/23/2017 Did a few things different and it tasted amazing! I always use MSG when seasoning meat, and it really is something I can't live without now. There are a lot of misconceptions about MSG in North America, but really it is just a form of salt that enhances meats natural flavour. This recipe was great however I added salt and pepper in the flour and Panko as well as directly on the chicken (with msg). Also I did the sauce different... I used hoisen sauce, siracha, ketchup, honey and a bit of this garlic mayo I had in the fridge.. it was great! 04 of 24 Photo by  Corey Culdice 04/08/2017 05 of 24 Photo by  DannyL 01/23/2017 06 of 24 Photo by  Kristopher Frederickson Pup B 07/22/2016 I have made this recipe about 6 times since I have come across it. The recipe is so easy, and tasty, and is a huge hit with my spouse who is a very fussy eater... The only changes I made to this recipe were to the Tankatsu sauce. I added an extra quarter cup of ketchup to the ingredients, and discovered that it not only cut the powerful taste of the Worsechester sauce but also gave it a little more zing... Great recipe for those pressed for time... 07 of 24 Photo by  Kristopher Frederickson Pup B 07/22/2016 I have made this recipe about 6 times since I have come across it. The recipe is so easy, and tasty, and is a huge hit with my spouse who is a very fussy eater... The only changes I made to this recipe were to the Tankatsu sauce. I added an extra quarter cup of ketchup to the ingredients, and discovered that it not only cut the powerful taste of the Worsechester sauce but also gave it a little more zing... Great recipe for those pressed for time... 08 of 24 Photo by  Neal Schwartz 07/08/2016 Good stuff! Chicken was good, I too tweaked the sauce after tasting it as written. I increased the soy sauce, decreased the worcestershire, added some mirin and Sriracha and ended up with an end product that was good. I have no idea what real tonkatsu sauce should taste like, but what I made tastes more like and better than the kikoman tonkatsu sauce that comes from the grocery store. Thanks for the recipe and the direction for the sauce! 09 of 24 Photo by  Myra Suraryo 03/20/2016 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Chicken Katsu 922 Ratings Steamed Egg (Chawan Mushi) 26 Ratings Juicy Chicken 32 Ratings Quick Oyakodon 28 Ratings Blackened Chicken Strips 3 Ratings Chicken with Lemon-Caper Sauce 463 Ratings Chinese-Inspired Chicken with Zucchini and Mushroom Medley 1 Rating Yakisoba Chicken 539 Ratings Keto Chicken Parmesan 165 Ratings Korean Spicy Chicken Tenders with Sweet Apple 31 Ratings Sesame Tuna with Soy Miso Dressing 26 Ratings Gyudon Japanese Beef Bowl 11 Ratings Kid-Friendly Chicken Katsu Japanese-Style Deep Fried Chicken 77 Ratings 6 Katsu Recipes to Try ASAP Joe's General Tso's Chicken 115 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: BASKETBALLGIRL
instructions: For the sauce, stir together the Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, and soy sauce, and a pinch of pepper to taste. Set aside.;Heat oil in deep-fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Place flour and panko bread crumbs onto separate plates and season with salt and pepper. Place the beaten egg in a medium bowl. Dip flattened chicken pieces first into flour, then egg, and lastly bread crumbs.;Fry breaded chicken breasts in preheated oil until golden brown and no longer pink in center, about 8 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to absorb excess oil. Slice chicken into thin strips and top with a drizzle of sauce and a sprinkling of sliced green onions. Serve remaining sauce on the side for dipping.
